intro: Chromolaena morii, commonly known as the Hawaiian tridax, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by fluffy, white seeds that aid in wind dispersal. Chromolaena morii is an invasive species in many regions, often outcompeting native vegetation. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a significant ecological concern in tropical and subtropical areas.
